Fields.DialogueText: The ship really does look good as new, doesn't she?
Not new, exactly. It's just hasn't seen much battle yet. But the US Navy has every faith in her abilities.
And I hear her captain has something of a knack for dealing with this new threat as well.

Fields.MenuText: I won't disappoint, Admiral.
Admiral, you make me sound almost bloodthirsty.
Why do I feel like the weight of the world just shifted to my shoulders?

Fields.DialogueText: You better not. We'll be keeping a close eye on you.
Let's just say we're confident in your abilities as a captain.
Heh, that's odd, because I feel light as a feather all of a sudden.
Hey! Is that you, Captain?! Yes! Finally! I feel like I've been waiting all day. Hell, I've been waiting longer than that - I've been waiting my whole life. Can we get going already?
Nice to see you again, St. Louis.
Still raring to go, I see.
Yes, Captain! You won't find anyone more raring than me. I'm the raringist... rarest... rar...  I'm suuuuuper eager.
Captain, Admiral, we've been alerted to a squad of Morganas moving towards us. Should I send units to intercept?
Yes, make it qu...
Ahem. I'm right here, ya know.
She's right. I think we can handle this.
All right, I'll leave it to you then, Captain.
Thank you, Admiral.
All right, c'mon! I wanna see something go boom.
@BATTLE
That last battle was so much better than I thought it would be.

Fields.MenuText: I think you might be doing it wrong. Battle isn't supposed to be fun.
Eh, it was a little easy for my tastes.
I know! Did you see the shells tear into her hull?  Highlight of my day.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not wrong to love your work. If you're not having fun, don't rain on my parade, Cap.
Oh, seriously? I hope we get assigned a super dangerous mission, then.
Does great stuff like that happen a lot around you?
Captain, we're picking up more Morganas nearby.
Let's take 'em out before we head back. We've got time, right?
Why not? Let's get ready for another engagement.
Let's go!
@BATTLE
I'm not trying to rain on anything, just remember that if you're not careful, you could die in an engagement like that.
I'm not going to die. Trust me.
Excellent. As long as you don't mean it in a death wishy kind of way.
No, I just want to see my big strong captain take on a Morgana single-handedly, or something equally as epic.
Occasionally. You know, I don't often think about how dangerous my life has been getting.
I knew you'd be the best captain.
You did good out there, you two.
We were brilliant. Save your "good" for the B-team, Admiral!

Fields.MenuText: *swat* Hey, you can be eager, but don't get cocky.
I guess that makes us the A-team.
I think we're ready for something a little more challenging, don't you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Ouch, hey, don't swat me. *swat*
A is for awesome. In case you didn't get that, Admiral.
May I suggest something with dragons? If you have any.
You two should get all your ducks in a row. I'll have your assignment for you soon.
Oh, my God! My first mission, Captain, did you hear that? He said “assignment” and “your” in the same sentence.
And he was even referring to you when he said it.
Exactly. That's the important part. I wouldn't be as excited if he was talking to you.
Well, maybe he was, you don't know...
Shut up, don't ruin this for me.
Let's just go on a quick patrol, sound good?
If by patrol you mean fight, then yes.
@BATTLE
It's good you're getting closer. It will serve you well in the future.
Oh, I got it, St. Louis, don't worry. I'll make sure your first mission is a good one.
I'll look into it.
St. Louis, are those baseballs?
No, they're footballs, that's why I'm hitting them with the bat. Any other stupid questions, Cap?
How about why you're hitting baseballs on the deck?
Well, if I were hitting them inside, that would just be dangerous.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have to be hitting them towards port?
How many do you have there?
Any home runs?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't want to lose my balls in the ocean.
I think in total I have about sixty-three. Maybe... damn, now I need to count them.
Every hit's a home run. Ya know, if I had bases. And a team. And another team to play against. But, yeah, tons of home runs.
Just try not to hurt anybody, okay?
Don't worry, I've got an officer in the outfield catching everything.
That's not the outfield. That's a town.
Not when I'm in the zone.
Captain, St. Louis, we're picking up on some Morganas nearby.
Are they headed our way?
Does that matter? Let's go!
@BATTLE
Full house. I'd like to see somebody beat that.
Yeah, I've got nothing. Damn.
You got me beat.
Just take your money.
Heh heh heh, thanks for the bonus, Captain.
I still don't get this game. You said I'd have fun.

Fields.MenuText: I explained it, St. Louis. Were you not paying attention?
Maybe it's just not your game. Not everyone has a taste for poker.
If you're not having fun, you can leave. I'll take your chips.

Fields.DialogueText: I was paying attention. I just don't get it.
This is a game? The only one that looks like he's having fun is that guy.
... I'm not sure what that means. But no. My chips.
Wait, how do you know if you've got a good hand again?
Well, just put it down now and we'll tell you.
This any good?
Dammit! Four of a kind!?
Yeah, St. Louis, that's good.
Here are your stupid chips.
These are all mine? Now I get it. This game is pretty fun!
@BATTLE
Well, he just won the hand.
Ohhhh.
Do you think my first proper assignment will be like a super-secretive covert operation?
Are you talking espionage, here?
Oh, that would be great. I'd make an excellent spy. I'd swoop in and out before anyone even knew I was there.

Fields.MenuText: An escort mission or a simple patrol.
Something with more explosions and fighting.
Something bureaucratic and boring.

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds stupid. We're too good for something like that.
Explosions and fighting sound good. I'm always up for explosions and fighting.
Bleh. I say "bleh" to that suggestion.
Whatever it is, it's gotta be something exciting.
Didn't you mention something with a dragon?
Yeah, but I'm not stupid, I know dragons aren't real... right?
It wasn't that long ago we didn't think Morganas or Belles were real.
So that means... I can have my dragon?
Have your... *sigh* Yeah, sure, maybe.
*ALARM*
That doesn't sound like the dragon alarm.
We don't have a dragon alarm.
Not that you know about.
@BATTLE
Admiral, I hope you're here with the mission. St. Louis won't stop talking about it.
I imagine she's gotten a little stir crazy.
Oh, hey, Admiral! When did you get here? Is that our new mission? If it is, I'm liable to hug you.
Please don't. I'm an admiral, for God's sake.
*raspberry* Fine, just gimme.
Here. One for you, and one for you, Captain.
Hmmm, you want us to go to Germany?
Ich spreche Deutsch. Sprechen sie deutsche?
Huh?
Come on, Captain, keep up!
It's more than just a trip to Germany. You're going to deliver some very important cargo. It's a sort of payment. If you fail, the consequences could be unpleasant.
Please, Admiral, I don't fail.

Fields.MenuText: We can handle this.
I have some concer...
*shrugs* Eh, better than sitting on our hands here.

Fields.DialogueText: See, my captain has everything under control!
*Horribly loud fake coughs* I'm sorry, *cough* did you say something, Captain? *Coughing intensifies*
My hands were starting to fall asleep, let's give em something to shoot!
*ALARM*
Sounds like company.
Nothing I can't handle. Just watch and see.
@BATTLE
St. Louis, you know we're in the middle of a battle, right?
Tell me that doesn't look like a dragon. Look. Look right there.

Fields.MenuText: You know, you actually have a point.
That's a Morgana that's primed to attack.
What is up with you and dragons?

Fields.DialogueText: See? What are the odds?. We should take a picture or something.
Cap, does it really bother you so much to dream?
Everybody likes dragons. They're like ice cream, or music.
*BOOM*
If you keep talking about dragons, that sound will be the last thing we hear.
Such a drama queen. Let's go, then.
@BATTLE
*sigh* That's one dragon down.
Heheh, you just said dragon.
What? I said “one Morgana down.”
Sure you did.
Stop it with that grin. We're not going to start calling them dragons.
How did you know that's what I was thinking? We are totally in sync, Captain!
*ALARM*
Huhuhu, these guys look like they want to give us a run for our money. Let's show 'em what we got.
You don't have to be so cocky about it.
Who's cocky? I'm not cocky. I'm just damn good.
Spinning your gun on your finger like that is the cockiest thing you can do.
Nuh uh, you wanna see cocky, look at this.
*BANG*

Fields.MenuText: Are they shooting at us?!
What the... did you just...?
If you just shot yourself, I swear to God...

Fields.DialogueText: Nope, not yet. That one was me.
Yeah, kinda, but everything's okay. I think.
Nope. No no no no. Yeah, no hole. All good.
All right, everyone. Keep your eyes on the Morganas coming our way.
Huh, I really could've shot myself there.
You good to go, St. Louis?
Yeah, I guess... maybe I didn't load it properly?
Not what I meant.
I'm fine, don't worry about me. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Did you see what happened?
What are you talking about? Are you drunk again?
Shut up. I'm talking about what happened with St. Louis on the bridge. She shot herself in the foot.
What? Seriously? Belles can do that?
No, the thing is, she missed or something. She doesn't got a mark. And it was at point blank range.
That's impossible. You don't miss at point blank.
That's what I hear.
So you didn't even see it yourself? Shut up, ya fool. Let's get back to work.
I'm not making this up. It happened.
I didn't think it was that big of a deal. I'm just a klutz.

Fields.MenuText: Well, everyone's talking about it. They're calling you bulletproof.
Huh, did you say something? I was kind of daydreaming.
It's not that big of a deal. That's the first I've heard anyone talk about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, that would be great. I could bounce 'em off me and right back to my enemies. I could be like Superman or something.
Oh, I do that too. I like turning the pictures in the clouds into stories. That's not weird, is it?
Oh, really? I guess it'll blow over soon, then.
*ALARM*
Morganas.
Try not to shoot yourself this time.
I didn't shoot myself. I got no holes!
@BATTLE
Hmmm, I wonder what's in this thing?

Fields.MenuText: Open it and find out.
Don't know, don't care. It's just the job.
Whatever it is, I can guarantee it's not a dragon.

Fields.DialogueText: You think I won't? 'Cuz I will. I'll open the crap out of this crate.
That kind of attitude is boring. Gotta give in to the adventure of things, Cap.
Hey, I'm not stupid. Of course it's not a dragon. The crate is too small to fit a whole dragon inside.
Okay, too much suspense, I'm opening it. Hand me that crowbar.
That thing's heavy duty. You're not going to smash it open with crowbar.
Shut up. I'll handle it.
*Series of whacks of varying speeds followed by heavy breathing*
Very impressive.
I said shut up. I'm just getting started over here.
Fine, continue. I'll just sit here and watch.
Or, you know, you could help.
I thought you were handling it.
*angry sigh*
*ALARM*
Give the crate a rest, because we've got bigger fish to fry.
There is no bigger fish. This crate must die!
Come on, don't make me drag you out of here.
@BATTLE
Ich kann Deutschland sehen.

Fields.MenuText: Your accent is atrocious.
Already? That was fast.
Stop it, you're giving me a headache.

Fields.DialogueText: Did I ask for commentary from the audience? Did I?
You understood me?
Germany is in sight. Is that better?
You know, I'm a little disappointed. I was hoping my first real mission would be epic and bloody, with missiles and bombers and battle scars and stuff like that.
I'm sure you'll get there one day. This is just your first of many steps.
I'mma have tons of steps. I'm going to take these steps two by two. I'll be at the top before you know it.
You keep up that attitude and I'm sure you will.
Captain, we have Morganas on approach.
What do you know, there's another step right there.
Let's turn that step into a crater.
@BATTLE
You're not the only one who can speak German, you know.
Much. Goodbye headache.
Captain, the German officers have boarded. They're waiting on deck for you.
Thank you, let them know I'll be right out.
I bet they're stuffy and all uptight, don't'cha think?

Fields.MenuText: I don't have a lot of time to think, St. Louis. I've got too much paperwork to finish.
The German Navy does have a reputation to uphold.
Compared to you, everyone's stuffy and uptight.

Fields.DialogueText: You should've thought about that before they got here.
Do they? Somebody should tell me these things!
I choose to take that as a complement. So thank you, Cap.
*sigh* Just stop bugging me and go show our guests around, okay?
Fine. I'll go do just that. It shouldn't be that hard.
Excellent.
Three.
Two.
One. Annnnd...
Caaaaaptain...
What?
They're awful. *whiny whisper* Heeeeeelp.
Heh, okay, I'll come and save you.
Or maybe we can just sound the alarm and escort them off the ship?
*ALARM*
Oooh, looks like someone else had the same idea.
Or we've got a fight on our hands.
Either way, I win.
@BATTLE
Well, that's done with, now what? Do we just head off to the nearest friendly port?
Or one of a random hundred crisis points, sure. That's the plan.
You know what I wish would happen?

Fields.MenuText: I'm going to say that you wish you had cake right now.
Let me guess, dragons?
Honestly, I have no idea.

Fields.DialogueText: No... well, now I do. Thanks a lot.
Shut up, I'm not dragon obsessed. I like other great stuff too.
Good, I like being an enigma. It's more fun that way.
Before we get back to American waters, I just want to run into a huge Morgana. Or maybe a massive flotilla of them.
That's a horrible thing to wish for. Take it back.
No, it's not a bad thing. I just want to have something to boast about.
Captain, there's a disturbance to the north. We think it might be Morganas attacking a settlement, or maybe a nest of them.
*sigh* You're not allowed to wish for things anymore.
Hehe, try and stop me.
@BATTLE
This is what you wanted, right? A fleet of Morganas?
Well, I didn't think there would be this many, but yeah, totally. This is great!
We're surrounded on all sides and there doesn't seem to be an end to them.
Yeah, but we're still gonna win.

Fields.MenuText: We're not winning until we've won.
Shut up, you don't know that.
Well, you have a point. We do kick ass.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that's a stupid thing to say. As long as we're still standing, we're winning.
You shut up. You don't know half the things you think you know.
We're kicking all the ass. These Morganas aren't going to be able to sit for weeks.
I'm pretty sure that's not how that works.
Too late to worry about that now. I already said it, and now it's time for battle.
Don't say that with a smile!
@BATTLE
They're saying she asked for it just seconds before it happened.
She asked for a Morgana horde?
I guess she was bored or something.
Well, that does sound like her.
Yeah, I just hope she doesn't get so bored that she wishes for a shipwreck or something.
She's not a genie or something, man.
Idiot, genies grant wishes, they don't get their wishes granted.
Oh, so maybe she has a genie.
Or she's a witch.
Shut up, I'm not a witch or a genie or whatever. Shut up.
*scream*

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, scare 'em, that'll make them think you're not a witch.
Serves 'em right for spreading rumors.
You okay, St. Louis?

Fields.DialogueText: Shut up. I don't want sarcasm right now.
Yeah, rumors are stupid. They don't know what they're talkin' about.
... Yeah, I guess I'm okay. Thanks for asking.
I just don't want everyone to be scared of me.
Well... maybe stop wishing for bad stuff to happen to us. It'll probably still happen, but people are less likely to blame you that way.
*ALARM*
I swear I didn't do it this time.
You didn't do it last time either. Come on, let's go take care of some Morganas.
@BATTLE
Hey, I just realized the Germans didn't give us anything in return for the crate.
Nope. Your point?
Well, we could've just dumped the crate in the ocean and come back and no one would've known, right?

Fields.MenuText: I think they would've figured it out when the Germans demanded the payment they never got.
That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard.
That's not how you complete a mission, St. Louis.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah... that would've been bad. It's a good thing we didn't take that shortcut.
You're the stupidest thing I've ever heard.
I know, I was just thinking we could've already been on our next mission, is all.
I just hope our next mission is a little more exciting.
It's more likely now that we've really proven ourselves.
You think?
Don't worry, I see many an intense battle in your future.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devil.
I wish. It's probably just more Morganas. Just think how much credit we'd get for taking down the devil!
You scare me sometimes.
@BATTLE
Stop it or make sense.
Watching the skies for anything in particular?
... I wish I could fly.

Fields.MenuText: They're a little noisy for my tastes.
Can't Belles hover?
In a plane, or with actual wings?

Fields.DialogueText: The noise is half the appeal. They sound so great, so powerful. I just love it.
It's not the same. I can't hover from New York to Paris in one trip.
Hmmm, actually both sound pretty fun to me.
They're not actually all that comfortable to ride in, for what it's worth. You're not missing too much being... well, here.
It would be nice to have the option. Stupid giant ship body... I'm sorry, hull, I didn't mean that. You know I love you.
You know, maybe one day you won't be so tethered to the ship. Maybe you'll be able to do laps around it or something.
That'd be fun. I could skim the water and scare everyone by flying way too close.
On second thought, maybe you shouldn't fly after all.
Hey, no fair, don't dangle my dreams in front of me and snatch them away like that.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
St. Louis, are you taking a nap on deck?
Even I need to sleep sometimes, Captain.
But why in the middle of the deck? You're getting in everyone's way.
No one said anything to me about it.

Fields.MenuText: They're all too polite.
They're probably scared of you.
I'm saying something.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I don't believe that. I've heard some of the crew use some harsh language.
Of lil ol' me? I'm just a sweet little girl. I couldn't scare a fly.
You don't count. You're not important.
*long dramatic yawn* This is what I get for staying up all night. Never again. Well, I say that, but it'll happen again. And often.
You really should sleep like a normal person. In your bed.
But then if something important happens, I'll miss it.
I promise if anything happens, I'll come and get you personally.
You swear?
Cross my heart.
Fine, I'll go nap in my room.
*ALARM*
Hah, just as well, I was just going to go to my room and read.
A little ball of energy.
@BATTLE
I'm the captain.
You say that like I should care.
St. Louis, you up in there? We've spotted land.
Seriously? That means we're this much closer to our next dragon filled mission!
What are you carrying? Are those clothes?
What? These are my PJs. They're covered in baseballs and bats. You got a problem with baseball now?

Fields.MenuText: Ooooh, those are bats. Nevermind.
No, I just wasn't expecting you to own anything so... adorable.
I'm not a sports person, you know that.

Fields.DialogueText: What did you think they were? No, never mind, don't care.
They're so comfortable, though.
I most certainly did not. I just lost a little respect for you.
How much longer until we arrive?
We still have some time, but we'll be there soon.
Do I still have time to read, or do you need me on deck?
What are you reading?
A little Twain. I love it. It always puts me to sleep, though.
Huh, you read Twain. Honestly, I wasn't even sure whether you could read at all.
Rude. Just plain ol' rude for no reason.
*ALARM*
I guess that means Twain will have to wait.
That's fine. It's not going anywhere.
And the pajamas?
I'm thinking about taking them with me. In case the Morganas are so boring I need to nap.
@BATTLE
Hey, St. Louis, could you pick my lottery numbers?
Hmmm? Uh, okay, I guess.
Hey, St. Louis, can I just shake your hand really quickly?
All right, this is weird. Hey, quit smelling my hair!
*Sailors clamoring*
Caaaaptain! What's going on!?
You didn't hear? The rumors about you spread around the base. The current theory is that you're luckier than a four leaf clover tied around a rabbit's foot.
Better than people thinking I'm a witch, I guess. But can you get people to stop rubbing me like I'm some kind of lucky penny?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know. They might riot if I try.
All right, everyone. Time to clear out! Give the lady some space.
Actually, I was going to pop in there and give your hair a quick squeeze.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, if you're not going to help, I'll have to take care of things myself.
Caaaaaaptain, they're not stopping!
No, no more squeezing. This ends now.
Next person that touches me loses a finger! *chomping*
*ALARM*
Phew, thank the Lord for Morganas.
It'll all be okay, hang in there.
Get your hand off my head! I know what you're doing! *chomping*
@BATTLE
I've already gotten word that the package has been delivered. Your first mission was an outstanding success, St. Louis.
Told you so. Maybe next time make it a little harder. This was like a two, I'm hoping the next one will be around an eight.
Ahaha, I'm glad to see experience hasn't changed you one bit.
It's amazing. She's almost inflexibly enthusiastic.
Hey, I'm plenty flexible. See?

Fields.MenuText: Stand up. That's not how you behave in front of an admiral.
Pshaw, you call that flexible? Watch this.
That's a different kind of flexibility, St. Louis.

Fields.DialogueText: How should I behave then? All stiff and cordial? No thanks, sounds too boring.
Oh, we going to have a showdown? Get ready, 'cause I ain't even started yet.
Now who's not flexible?
I'm glad you two have returned in one piece. Just try not to cause too much trouble for each other before I return with your next mission.
Each other? Don't look at me, I'm a saint.
Ahem, do you not even know my name?
Go take a patrol, or resupply. Enjoy your break. I'll return soon.
It might be your name, but you cause too much trouble to be an actual saint.
Shut up. *whack*
@BATTLE
Can you wait until I'm done to do this?
Yes, Admiral.
Sorry, Admiral.
*sigh*
How are our supplies looking?
I don't know. It looks good, I guess.
I asked you to take inventory.
I did. We have all the stuff on the list.
You just wrote a bunch of checkmarks. You didn't write any amounts.
I was supposed to write amounts? You didn't tell me I was supposed to write amounts.

Fields.MenuText: I shouldn't have to. You should know how to do this.
You're right, I guess I just assumed you'd know how to do this.
Do I need to hold your hand for everything?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm new. I've never really used much of my inventory before. And I'm new.
Well, you shouldn't assume. It makes an "ass" out of "u" and "me."
Not for everything. Just a few things. Like when I'm watching a scary movie, or taking a walk in the park, or when I'm doing something I've never done before!
Captain, St. Louis, we've been alerted to a Morgana threat to the south. We've been ordered to deal with it.
Ordered? Is this our next mission?
It was more of a request. They seemed to be under the impression that St. Louis was getting a little stir crazy.
Look at that, it seems like they know me better than you.
@BATTLE
You already said that.
It's important.
What the... did they evolve or something!?

Fields.MenuText: It's just a bigger Morgana. Keep your head in the game.
I hope not. That would spell trouble for all of us.
You've never seen a Morgana that size before? Please, it's probably just an appetizer.

Fields.DialogueText: My head is all up in the game. My head's so far in the game that all I can see is the game.
Trouble. Pshaw. I don't even know how to spell it.
Seriously? You mean they get even bigger? I can't wait!
Captain, there's a torpedo coming straight for us. It's the size of Delaware.
Ho, I see it. I got this, guys.
St. Louis, what are you thinking?
Check this out, it's going to be great! *splash*
St. Louis! Get back on this boat!
She's swimming toward the torpedo.
She's not that stupid, is she? Is she seriously going to try and take a torpedo head on?
*BOOM*
There's your answer.
St. Louis!
What? You don't have to shout. I didn't go that far.
How are you still in one piece?
You seriously wanna talk right now? We've got this bad mamajama breathing down our necks.
Let's talk later.
@BATTLE
What did I say about the rubbing!? Get off me!
It's unbelievable, she actually took that torpedo head on.
She said she hit it back toward the Morgana like a baseball.
I don't know why it didn't explode right then and there. It should've.
She's just lucky, I guess.
You really think she's a good luck charm, like everyone's saying?
Honestly?

Fields.MenuText: I think we're lucky to have her here.
I think the whole damn ship is a good luck charm.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I was under the impression she got under your skin.
Maybe you're right about that.
Caaaaptain! Get 'em off me! Biting won't even stop them now! I think the freaks are liking it or something!
Everyone get back to your stations! We still need to return to base and I won't have any Morganas blindsiding us because you're all aggravating our Belle!
That's right! Back, all of you! I got the Captain in my corner!
I meant you, too, St. Louis. We've got places to be.
*raspberry* I know. I'm going. Sheesh.
Maybe that's what I like about her.
